body: Can this be replicated in any sort of test? Maybe one that uses `str_replace` to replace line endings before sending to Psalm?

Could be reproduced on Psalm's codebase (probably any sufficiently large and complex codebase would do): just convert all PHP files to DOS line endings:
```console
$ find src -type f -exec sed -i 's/$/\r/g' {} \;
```

issue.title: array_keys() issue only with phar version

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

body:
I tried to running current unit tests on Windows for starters.

With CRLF line endings (which is how git checks out by default on Windows):

```
ERRORS!
Tests: 4531, Assertions: 9824, Errors: 15, Failures: 191, Skipped: 29.
```

With LF line endings (search/replace on *.php):

```
ERRORS!
Tests: 4531, Assertions: 9931, Errors: 2, Failures: 1, Skipped: 29.
```

So line endings of Psalm source do seem to make a significant impact on operation...

Might make sense to add Windows to CI, if possible?

As a git level fix, it seems `.gitattributes` can be configured to normalize to specific line endings, which would prevent source from ending up with CRLF line endings on Win:

```
*.php	text eol=lf
```
https://www.git-scm.com/docs/gitattributes#_code_eol_code

> Might make sense to add Windows to CI, if possible?

There are Windows CI jobs running on AppVeyor: e.g.https://ci.appveyor.com/project/muglug/psalm/builds/31356395
Ah, missed it, sorry! :) Any idea what its git settings are in regards to CRLF?
Yeah, `input` would not cause CRLF check out (only enforce LF on commit), while it's commonly `true` on Windows because that's git installer default/recommended.

I want to point out that this is an issue when checking code that has CRLF breaks in it - not only for psalm checking itself. None the less thanks for all your input!

I agree with @muglug that we should add an test for this and from your feedback on the issue I gather that it is a relevant point, so I will look deeper into it and try to provide a fix.
AppVeyor builds will now run with CRLF breaks after 9484231 which should prevent this, once fixed, from reoccurring
I can confirm this works like a charm now - thanks for the quick fix!

issue.title: Added tests for docblock breaking CRLF

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications
